organisation_name: PIANC, the World Association for Waterborne Transport Infrastructure (PIANC)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Commission Expert Group on Strategic Coordination for the Marine Strategy Framework Directive #E02550#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=2550#Observer#C#Working group on Data Information and Knowledge Exchange (WG DIKE)#Working group on Good environmental Status (WG GES)#Working group Programme of Measures, Economic and Social Assessment (WG POMESA)#Strategic Coordination Group for the Water Framework and Floods Directives#E00371#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=371#Member#C#ATG Article 4.7 guidance#Ecostat#Chemicals
membership: PIANC leads the Think Climate coalition see http://www.pianc.org/thinkclimate.php and participates in the MSFD NAVI group http://www.dredging.org/msfd
goals__remit:
PIANC is the forum where professionals around the world join forces to provide expert advice on cost-effective, reliable and sustainable infrastructures to facilitate the growth of waterborne transport.  
As a non-political and non-profit organisation established in 1885, PIANC brings together the best international experts on technical, economic and environmental issues pertaining to waterborne transport infrastructures. Members include national governments and public authorities, corporations and interested individuals. 
 
Mission: 
To provide expert guidance, recommendations and technical advice 
·         Bringing together the best international experts, both public and private, on technical, economic and environmental issues pertaining to waterborne transport infrastructure 
·         High-quality Technical Reports and Briefs 
·         International Commissions and Working Groups 
  
To keep the international waterborne transport community connected 
·         Four-yearly International Congresses 
·         Four-yearly PIANC-COPEDEC International Conferences on Coastal and Port Engineering in Developing Countries 
·         E-Newsletter ‘Sailing Ahead’
relevant_communication: PIANC leads the thematic cluster of navigation-related organisations participating in the EU Water Framework Directive Strategic Coordination Group (see http://www.pianc.org/euwfd.php) and also attends meetings of the EU Marine Strategy Framework Directive Strategic Coordination Group where the navigation sector thematic cluster lead is CEDA
